He took retirement for wife; she collapsed at his farewell! they took her to hospital, but she was… - India.com
summary:
He took retirement for wife; she collapsed at his farewell! they took her to hospital, but she was…

Date: December 25, 2024 Source: India.com

A heart-wrenching incident unfolded in Kota, Rajasthan, when a government employee’s farewell party turned into a tragedy. Devendra had taken voluntary retirement to care for his ailing wife, Deepika, but tragically, she collapsed and passed away during the celebration.

Key Points:

  • Devendra dedicated his retirement to caring for his wife, who had health issues.
  • The farewell party, meant to celebrate his retirement, ended in disaster as Deepika collapsed.
  • A video of the incident went viral, showing the couple moments before the collapse.
  • Despite immediate help, Deepika was pronounced dead at the hospital.
  • Public reactions on social media expressed grief and suggestions for emergency preparedness.
"राजस्थान के कोटा जिला में एक भावुक घटना घटित पत्नी की देखभाल के लिए वॉलंटरी रिटायरमेंट लिया, लेकिन रिटायरमेंट का जश्न मनाते हुए पत्नी ने इस दुनिया को अलविदा कह दिया।"
— Banwari Lal – Bairwa (Civil Engineer)

The incident reveals the profound unpredictability of life during significant moments and highlights Devendra's commitment.
newTitle: Tragic Farewell: Man's Retirement Celebration Turns to Heartbreak in Rajasthan

title: Maharashtra Govt Hikes Charges For High Security Number Plates, Check New Rates Here - News18
summary:
Maharashtra Increases Fees for High-Security Number Plates – New Rates Revealed

Publication Date: December 26, 2024, Source: News18 Hindi

Car and bike owners in Maharashtra will now have to pay more for High-Security Number Plates (HSRP) for vehicles registered before April 1, 2019, following a recent announcement by the Maharashtra Transport Department.

  • The installation cost for two-wheelers (motorcycles, scooters, tractors) is Rs 531.
  • The cost for three-wheelers (auto-rickshaws) is Rs 590.
  • Larger vehicles (cars, buses, trucks, and more) will now incur a fee of Rs 879.
  • HSRP includes unique identification features to enhance security against forgery.
  • The Maharashtra Transport Department has activated a payment link for the new rates.
“The High-Security Registration Plate (HSRP) is designed to be tamper-proof and difficult to duplicate.”

The state transport department has provided an appointment facility on its website for installing HSRP on old vehicles, aiming to improve vehicle registration security.
newTitle: Maharashtra Increases Fees for High-Security Number Plates – New Rates Revealed

summary:
Indian CEO warns of the harsh realities behind 'startup romance'

Date: Dec 26, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Radhika Gupta, CEO of Edelweiss Mutual Fund, warns against the glamorization of startup culture, highlighting the difficult realities that come with entrepreneurship.

  • Startup culture in India has significantly grown, attracting many young individuals towards entrepreneurship.
  • Gupta advises against the 'startup romance' perception that depicts startup life as easy and glamorous.
  • She outlines the harsh truths of startup life, including execution pain, budget constraints, and the stress of constant rejection.
  • The reaction on social media is mixed, with differing opinions on the risks and rewards of starting a business.
“Startup reality hits soon. It means painful execution, limited budgets and even more limited working conditions...” - Radhika Gupta

This warning from the CEO encourages prospective entrepreneurs to realistically evaluate the challenges of startup life, despite its appealing facade.

CCPA fines three coaching institutes for misleading UPSC exam claims | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
CCPA fines three coaching institutes for misleading UPSC exam claims

Date: Dec 26, 2023

Source: PTI

The Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has imposed penalties totalling ₹15 lakh on three coaching institutes for making misleading advertisements about their success rates in civil services examinations.

  • Vajirao & Reddy Institute and StudyIQ IAS were each fined ₹700,000.
  • Edge IAS was penalised ₹100,000 for deceptive claims regarding their results in the UPSC Civil Services Examinations.
  • The CCPA found that the institutes misrepresented the effectiveness of their courses by concealing that successful candidates had only enrolled in Interview Guidance Programs.
  • The CCPA has issued 45 notices to various coaching institutes for misleading advertisements, totaling ₹71.6 lakh in penalties from 22 institutes to date.
The advertisements that deliberately conceal important information are classified as misleading and subject to penalties under the Consumer Protection Act, 2019.

This action highlights the CCPA's commitment to curbing misleading practices in the educational sector and protecting consumer rights.
newTitle: CCPA fines three coaching institutes for misleading UPSC exam claims

title: AAP Says Will Ask INDIA Bloc To Remove Congress From Alliance If... - NDTV
summary:
AAP Threatens to Remove Congress from INDIA Alliance Over Ajay Maken Controversy

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

In a major setback for opposition unity, the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has announced intentions to request Congress's removal from the INDIA alliance if it does not take action against its Delhi leader, Ajay Maken.

  • AAP accuses Congress of facilitating BJP's electoral success ahead of the Delhi Assembly elections.
  • Allegations arise that Ajay Maken's statements align with BJP's agenda.
  • The face-off follows previous cooperation between AAP and Congress during the Lok Sabha elections.
  • AAP demands action against Maken within 24 hours or will seek Congress's removal from the alliance.
“All limits have been crossed,” said MP Sanjay Singh regarding Maken’s comments.

This situation highlights growing tensions within the opposition, as AAP asserts its stance against Congress's perceived alignment with BJP interests.

title: Over 260 Canadian Colleges, Rs 60 Lakh Per Person: Trafficking Of Indians Into US Under ED Lens - News18
summary:
Over 260 Canadian Colleges Under Investigation for Trafficking Indians to the US

Date: December 26, 2024 Source: News18

The Enforcement Directorate (ED) is investigating a human trafficking and money laundering scheme involving 262 Canadian colleges, accused of facilitating the illegal migration of Indians to the US through student visas. Allegations point to charges of up to 60 lakh INR per person for crossing the border.

  • The investigation is linked to a tragic incident where a family died while attempting to enter the US illegally from Canada.
  • ED's probe started from an FIR against main accused Bhavesh Ashokbhai Patel.
  • Patel allegedly led a conspiracy to traffick Indians via falsified college admissions in Canada.
  • Indians were charged between Rs 55-60 lakh for this service.
  • The investigation has revealed extensive networks involving thousands of agents connecting students with colleges.
  • In recent searches, the ED froze significant amounts of money and seized evidences related to the inquiry.
“About 25,000 students were being referred by one entity and more than 10,000 students by another entity to various colleges based outside India every year.”

The ED's ongoing investigation emphasizes the serious nature of human trafficking and the exploitation of Indian nationals seeking migration opportunities.
newTitle: Over 260 Canadian Colleges Under Investigation for Trafficking Indians to the US

title: Sexual assault on Anna University campus: Opposition parties stage protests in Chennai; Jayakumar, Tamilisai detained - The Hindu

Members of the All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK) and Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) staged protests in Chennai against the alleged sexual assault of a student on the Anna University campus, condemning the ruling DMK government.

  • AIADMK leader Edappadi K. Palaniswami questioned the safety measures in place on campus.
  • BJP members also protested, claiming the government failed to protect the identity of the survivor.
“How can one believe that the CCTV cameras in Tamil Nadu’s premier higher educational institute were not working?” - Edappadi K. Palaniswami

The protests emphasize rising concerns over student safety and accountability of the authorities in handling such incidents.
newTitle: Protests Erupt in Chennai Over Sexual Assault on Anna University Student

title: India map distorted at Belagavi Congress meet? BJP launches attack - Deccan Herald
summary:
BJP Criticizes Congress for Allegedly Distorted Map at Belagavi Meeting

Published on: 26 December 2024, 07:41 IST

The Congress is holding a significant Working Committee meeting in Belagavi, Karnataka, to mark the 100th anniversary of the historic Belgaum session. However, the event has attracted criticism from the BJP, which claims Congress disrespected India's sovereignty by displaying a distorted map depicting Kashmir as part of Pakistan.

  • The Congress Working Committee (CWC) meeting in Belagavi is notable for its historical significance.
  • The BJP accuses the Congress of showing disrespect for India’s sovereignty.
  • Key BJP leaders, including MP Sudhanshu Trivedi, voice strong criticisms against Congress's actions.
  • Shehzad Poonawalla remarks on Congress's alleged alignment with forces dividing India.
  • The Congress plans to address the issue of disrespect to B R Ambedkar during the meetings.
“This clearly shows Congress’ alliance with the forces that are dividing India into parts.” — Sudhanshu Trivedi
“Once again Congress sings Pakistan tune… They do not believe in Bharat Jodo or Sanvidhan but Bharat Todo.” — Shehzad Poonawalla

The Congress insists on protecting Mahatma Gandhi's legacy amid these criticisms, as the party continues with its planned events in Belagavi.
newTitle: BJP Criticizes Congress for Allegedly Distorted Map at Belagavi Meeting

title: BMWs, 4 BHK flat: Maharashtra govt contract worker swindles over Rs 21 cr; caught for lavish spendings - Deccan Herald
summary:
Maharashtra Contract Worker Defrauds Government of Over Rs 21 Crore

Published: 26 December 2024, Source: Deccan Herald

A Maharashtra government-contracted employee reportedly stole over Rs 21 crore to live a lavish lifestyle, buying BMW vehicles and a 4 BHK apartment.

  • Harsh Kumar Kshirsagar, a contractual employee, allegedly defrauded the government out of approximately Rs 21.59 crore.
  • The scheme also involved Yashoda Shetty and her husband, with the latter acquiring an SUV worth Rs 35 lakhs.
  • They made unauthorized transactions using internet banking, bypassing necessary approvals.
  • The fraud went unnoticed for six months until a departmental deputy director raised concerns.
  • Kshirsagar spent the stolen funds on luxury items, including diamond-studded glasses.
  • He is currently absconding as investigations continue.
“His acquaintances were left astonished at his new lifestyle, unable to understand how he afforded it.”

This case highlights significant corruption within government contracting processes, emphasizing the need for enhanced oversight and accountability.
newTitle: Maharashtra Contract Worker Defrauds Government of Over Rs 21 Crore

The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) is considering withdrawing from the INDIA alliance if Congress does not act against its leader Ajay Maken, who has been criticized for his statements against AAP and for allegedly collaborating with the BJP.

Uttar Pradesh: Fire breaks out at Greater Noida hospital - Hindustan Times
summary:
Fire Breaks Out at Greater Noida Hospital

Publication Date: Dec 26, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

A major fire broke out at a private hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida, causing panic among patients and staff as efforts were initiated to control the situation. Fortunately, no casualties were reported.

  • The fire incident occurred amidst a previous fire outbreak at an electronic equipment manufacturing company in Noida.
  • Thousands of rupees worth of goods were destroyed in the December 22 incident.
  • The fire department responded promptly with 17 vehicles and approximately 100 firefighters.
  • The blaze was contained after five hours of firefighting efforts.
  • The cause of the fire is believed to be sparks from electrical equipment and stored batteries.
No casualties were reported, and the total damage is still being assessed.

This incident highlights ongoing fire safety concerns at commercial facilities, emphasizing the need for better preventative measures and response protocols.
newTitle: Fire Breaks Out at Greater Noida Hospital

title: GST on selling old cars FAQs: From impact on dealers and individuals to tax calculation—all your questions answered | Mint - Mint
summary:
GST on Selling Old Cars FAQs: From Impact on Dealers and Individuals to Tax Calculation

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

The recent increase in the Goods and Services Tax (GST) on used cars to 18% has generated significant discussion regarding its impact on pricing and individuals involved in the used vehicle market.

  • The GST Council has increased the tax on used vehicles from 12% to 18%.
  • When individuals sell cars to other individuals, no GST is applicable.
  • GST will be applicable on margins when used cars are sold through dealers or platforms.
  • This increase is likely to raise costs for used cars sold through platforms while leaving individual sales unaffected.
  • Used car dealers are expected to bear the brunt of the price hikes and may pass costs onto consumers.
  • For used electric vehicles (EVs), a standard 18% GST is also applied.
“This move to harmonize tax slabs is likely to impact startup margins in the short term.” - Samiksha Goel and Sneha Shah

The increase in GST rates on used cars will have varied impacts; while individual sellers may remain unaffected, used car dealers could see a decline in business due to increased costs. Monitoring the responses of dealers and platforms will be crucial in evaluating the long-term effects of this tax change.
newTitle: GST on Selling Old Cars: Key FAQs Answered

The popular mall in North Bengaluru attracted a massive crowd on Christmas evening, leading to significant traffic issues in the area, causing many visitors to abandon their vehicles and walk 3 kilometers to reach the mall.

title: Assets And Liabilities Of Public Servant Cannot Be Shielded From Public Scrutiny, Be Completely Exempted... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Public Servant's Assets and Liabilities Subject to Scrutiny, Rules Madras High Court

Publication Date: 2024
Source: LiveLaw

The Madras High Court has ruled that the service register of public servants cannot be completely exempted from public access under the Right to Information Act, emphasizing that details regarding their assets and liabilities should be disclosed, albeit with reasonable restrictions.

  • The court held that assets and liabilities of public servants cannot be shielded from public scrutiny.
  • Justice CV Karthikeyan emphasized the need for reasonable restrictions on the type of information disclosed.
  • The ruling arose from a petition by M Tamilselvan seeking information about public servants' personal details.
  • The court rejected the argument that such information is exempt under Section 8 of the RTI Act.
  • The matter has been remanded for fresh consideration by the District Collector.
“No doubt, it is true that the assets and liability of a public servant will have to be necessarily disclosed and cannot be shielded from public scrutiny but there should be a reasonable restriction of the same,” the court stated.

In conclusion, the court's decision reinforces transparency in public service by ensuring that citizens have access to specific details concerning public servants' financial disclosure, thereby preventing corruption and promoting accountability.
newTitle: Public Servant's Assets and Liabilities Subject to Scrutiny, Rules Madras High Court

title: TS TET hall ticket 2024 today at tgtet2024.aptonline.in, here's how to download admit cards when released - Hindustan Times
summary:
TS TET Hall Ticket 2024 Release Today

Publication Date: December 26, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The Telangana School Education Department will release hall tickets for the Telangana Teacher Eligibility Test (TS TET) today, December 26. The exam is scheduled from January 1 to January 20, 2025.

  • Hall ticket release date: December 26
  • Exam dates: January 1 - January 20, 2025
  • Result announcement: February 5, 2025
  • Exam timings: 9 AM to 11:30 AM and 2 PM to 4:30 PM

How to Download TS TET Hall Ticket 2024

  1. Visit tgtet2024.aptonline.in
  2. Click on the download link for the TS TET admit card displayed on the homepage.
  3. Enter your login credentials.
  4. Submit and download the hall ticket.
  5. Review the instructions provided on the hall ticket.
  6. Print the hall ticket for exam day.

The minimum eligibility requirement includes having a DElEd, DEd, BEd, or equivalent qualification. The TS TET pass certificate is required to apply for teacher posts in various schools across Telangana.
newTitle: TS TET Hall Ticket 2024 Release and Download Instructions
